actions-list.actionItem: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Con. Res. 126 — "The title of this measure is not available."
Without objection, the Chair laid before the House H. Con. Res. 126.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

Considered by unanimous consent. H. Con. Res. 124 — "Authorizing the use of Emancipation Hall in the Capitol Visitor Center for a ceremony to present the Congressional Gold Medals awarded under the Hidden Figures Congressional Gold Medal Act."
Without objection, the Chair laid before the House H. Con. Res. 124.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Reverend Rachel Landers Vaagenes, Capitol Hill Presbyterian Church, Washington, D.C.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Larry Bucshon to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
